questions.question: What is the general rule of thumb for when a neural network is considered "deep learning"?

options.A: Any network with more than one output node
options.B: Any network with more than two or three layers
options.C: Any network using only linear activation functions
options.D: Any network that uses only image data

questions.question: **(Medium, Select all that apply):** Which of the following statements about deep learning are correct?

options.B: Each additional layer introduces another degree of nonlinearity
options.C: Deep learning always requires more than 100 layers
options.D: Deep learning models can have millions of parameters

questions.question: Why is adding more layers to a neural network associated with increased modeling of nonlinear relationships?

options.A: Each layer multiplies the input by zero
options.B: Each layer adds a new linear transformation
options.C: Each layer interacts with previous layers, introducing higher-order nonlinearities
options.D: More layers always make the model slower but not more expressive

sections.title: Section 2: Transfer Learning Concepts and Applications

questions.question: What is transfer learning in the context of NLP?

options.A: Training a model from scratch for every new task
options.B: Using a model trained on one task or corpus for a different but related task or corpus
options.C: Only using models for the same dataset they were trained on
options.D: Ignoring previous training when building new models

questions.question: **(Medium, Select all that apply):** In NLP, transfer learning can involve which of the following?

options.A: Using a model for a different reason on the same corpus
options.B: Using a model for a similar reason on a different corpus
options.C: Using a model for a different reason on a different corpus
options.D: Only using the model for the original task and corpus

questions.question: Why does transfer learning work well in NLP according to the lecture?

options.A: Context is similar across most language domains and problems
options.B: All words have the same meaning in every context
options.C: Transfer learning only works for image data
options.D: Transfer learning does not require any labeled data

questions.question: **(Hard, Select all that apply):** What are key benefits of transfer learning for deep learning models in NLP?

options.B: Reduces data requirements for new tasks
options.C: Allows starting from a model that already understands language context
options.D: Makes it impossible to fine-tune models for new domains

questions.question: In the provided example, which types of words or phrases are most likely to transfer well from movie reviews to patient feedback?

options.B: Generic sentiment terms like "absolutely fantastic" or "poor"

questions.question: What happens to embeddings and weights for words that do not translate well to a new domain during transfer learning?

options.A: They are always deleted from the model
options.B: Their weights are adjusted during fine-tuning
options.D: They are always set to zero

questions.question: **(Hard, Select all that apply):** According to the lecture, which of the following are accurate summaries of transfer learning in NLP?

options.A: Transfer learning is most effective when word context does not change drastically across domains
options.B: Few disciplines have a lexicon that is completely unique
options.C: Transfer learning requires millions of labeled examples for every new task
options.D: Deep learning models with transfer learning can capture language, context, and syntax for new tasks
